Detailed Description

Class that describes an Activity.
See also:
http://apps.sourceforge.net/trac/litesql/

Member Function Documentation

void pomotuxdatabase::Activity::Delete ( const litesql::Database &  rDatabase,
Activity &  rCurrentActivity,
ActivityInventorySheet &  rAIS,
TodoTodaySheet &  rTTS 
) [virtual]

This method deletes an activity in a clever way.
It searches for the activity in the Activity table, as well as in the corresponding relations ActivityInAIS and ActivityInTTS, deleting it.

Parameters:
rDatabase a reference to the current database used
rCurrentActivity a reference to the activity whe want to delete
rAIS a reference to the current Activity Inventory Sheet
rTTS a reference to the current Todo Today Sheet
See also:
Activity

ActivityInventorySheet

ActivityInAIS

TodoTodaySheet

ActivityInTTS

string pomotuxdatabase::Activity::GetDeadline (  )  [virtual]

Acts as a getter for Activity::mDeadline, as LiteSQL-0.3.3 has some bugs when using the public attribute directly.
The method is just a wrapper for Activity::HumanizeDate(mDeadline)

See also:
Activity

HumanizeDate

http://apps.sourceforge.net/trac/litesql

http://apps.sourceforge.net/trac/litesql/attachment/ticket/13/litesql-0.3.3-time.patch

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

string pomotuxdatabase::Activity::GetInsertionDate (  )  [virtual]

Acts as a getter for Activity::mInsertionDate, as LiteSQL-0.3.3 has some bugs when using the public attribute directly.
The method is just a wrapper for Activity::HumanizeDate(mInsertionDate)

See also:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

virtual std::string pomotuxdatabase::Activity::HumanizeDate ( std::string  unixDate  )  [virtual]

Converts a Unix date stored in a string to a human readable date (ISO 8601) again as a string.
This method makes sense using litesql-0.3.3 with Scott McFarland patch against LiteSQL datetime.ccp.
This method should probably change when litesql-0.3.4 comes out.

See also:
Activity

http://apps.sourceforge.net/trac/litesql

http://apps.sourceforge.net/trac/litesql/attachment/ticket/13/litesql-0.3.3-time.patch

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

Returns:
a ISO 8601 string containing the date (example: 2009-05-11)

virtual void pomotuxdatabase::Activity::Modify ( const litesql::Database &  rDatabase,
Activity &  rCurrentActivity,
int  newDeadline,
std::string  newDescription 
) [virtual]

This method modifies an existing activity.
We just let the user to modify its description and the deadline.

Parameters:
rDatabase a reference to the current database used
rCurrentActivity a reference to the activity whe want to delete
newDeadline the new deadline
newDescription the new description
See also:
Activity
